section.title: How to build KaarPux
section.para: &kx; contains scripts to build the complete &kx; distribution automatically.
&kx; is build using an existing Linux distribution, and will be installed on a disk partition on the system, so you can boot into it.

An overview of the complete build process is given in
with details provided in
Easier ways to build &kx; e.g. using virtual machines are shown in
In any case, you first use your existing Linux distribution to build a minimal bootable &kx; system. Then you boot into this system to build the rest of &kx;.
